result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The appeal is hereby dismissed pursuant to Wis Stat Rule 809.83(2)

The appellant shall file a memorandum by 7-26-19 addressing whether he is aggrieved by the granting of his motion for sentence credit and whether the appeal is moot; in the alternative, the appellant may file a notice of voluntary dismissal.  The filing of the appellant's brief is stayed; if this court confirms jurisdiction, the appellant's brief is due forty days from the order confirming jurisdiction.  The $195 filing fee shall be paid or a petition seeking waiver of the filing fee filed on or before July 26, 2019.

2:35 p.m. Cases called: 14CF220, 14CF304, 14CF561, 15CF171 & 15CF419, Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by victim and defendant's father. Sentencing statements by ADA Genda and Atty. Martinez. Court noted not enough time to finish today and continued sentencing to future date. Court told Defendant to be prepared to start serving sentence immediately. 15CF419 read in and dismissed. Court adjourned 3:30 p.m.

Cases called at 1:08 p.m.  - 14CF220, 14CF304, 14CF561 and 15CF171, Attorney Andrew I. Martinez. present. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin moved for revocation of bonds. Atty. Martinez made statement. Court revoked bond in all cases. Posted cash forfeited. Bond-only warrant issued to include neighboring states.  Defendant came into courtroom. Court negated its ruling. Atty. Martinez requested time to talk to his client. Court adjourned 1:15 p.m. Recalled at 1:27 p.m., defendant present now. Atty. Martinez stated he doesn't have discovery on defendant's new case, requested sentencing be set in 60 days. Defendant gave statement. ADA Genda requested sentencing be set as soon as possible. Judge addressed defendant. Current bonds continued.

Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter will be set for trial. Atty Martinez is to draft and order for other cases amending the bond conditions to allow third party contact for child.
